berry_et_al
image:image.image:caption: Differences changes in tree community dissimilarity with increasing distance between sites in unlogged and logged forest. Note that logged forests show a more rapid rate of change, suggesting that logging results in more variable ecological communities. Figure modified from Berry et al 2008.

image:image.image:title: Norden_Fig3
image:image.image:caption: Among-site variation in the values of the fitted parameters of non linear models. Derivatives of stem density (A–C), basal area (D–F), and species density (G–I) as a function of each of these properties alone.The derivative of each forest attribute is divided by its observed maximum to evaluate the contribution of each attribute to each derivative on a unitless scale. Note that stand age is not explicitly addressed in the plot axes
